pros: Love the people and mission
cons: As a company, it takes time to make any changes.

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator (HR Coordinator) in Northlake, IL
pros: This is an excellent company to work for overall. The benefits are good and most employees are very nice. The CEO is also awesome!
cons: While there has been a big push for diversity and inclusion, unfortunately that is not always practiced and certain ethnic groups are favored more than others. Managers also promise training that will strengthen you as an employee but it is possible that you will never receive it.

pros: Friendly staff from wide variety of backgrounds.
cons: Only a few staff a full understanding of how the organization functions.

pros: A great mix of long tenured and new employees.
cons: Stuck in old ways at a senior level.

job_title: Oncology Clinical Content Manager in Chicago, IL
pros: -Strong network of like-minded professionals -Strong leadership and people managers fosters a positive culture -Numerous opportunities for cross-functional work -Excellent ratio of teamwork and self-directed autonomy
cons: -Seasonal work emphasis could be better organized -Pay structure and tiering are not aligned to JD

review_title: The College of American Pathologists is a great place to work.
job_title: Talent Sourcing Partner in Northfield, IL
pros:
The culture within the CAP has been so warm and inviting. I’ve already met our CEO—He’s great by the way!

I had such a thorough interview team, everyone who interviewed me asked questions with intention. It speaks to the importance of the business and those selected to work towards the overall goals of the business. My whole onboarding experience was positive even after being in my role after several weeks. Everyone has been so engaging and inviting. I’ve come to notice that there is ALWAYS something to learn within the CAP, there’s always room for growth and development. As a life-long learner, I appreciate this kind of work environment.
cons: The CAP is not as diverse overall but the organization is working towards a more diverse work environment. In fact, when I was hired on everyone on the interview team acknowledged this challenge and have shared their ongoing plan towards a more diverse work environment, so I appreciate their efforts.

pros: Compensation is very good for the field of Instructional Design.
cons: The workload is impossible as they are combining jobs into one.

pros: Great people, good benefits, opportunities to advance
cons: Legacy applications, slow to change

review_title: Decent benefits, lacks diversity in leadership roles
pros: Benefits are good. Promoted work life balance
cons:
Culture of indifference to diversity particularly in leadership roles.
CEO's comment on diversity does not feel genuine. Comes across as checking a box for compliance reasons.
Very old school culture. Physician members are the decision makers and do not tap into the wealth of talent from the highly accomplished staff.

review_title: Very god place to work and retire
pros: Excellent work environment. Freedom and opportunity to learn
cons: decisions are a bit slow.

job_title: Desktop Support Technician in Fort Myers, FL
pros: I get exposure to the lasted technologies
cons: I take on a lot of responsabilities

review_title: Great place to work but gets to be a little boring
pros: A lot to learn at first, great benefits, stable career
cons: seniority matters too much, decisions are made too slow

review_title: Good Place To Work - Could Be Great With A Few Changes
pros:
The CAP has a set of staff values that describe how employees must work together.  It feels pretty collaborative and respectful, versus the dog-eat-dog culture of the corporate world.  While they look to grow revenue, the business model and success in the lab space provides a pretty stable environment for people who are fed up with the ups and downs of a profit focused industry.  The "mission"  gives even staff without medical backgrounds a chance to contribute to improved patient care.

It's technically a non-profit but you get to work on the projects and improvements that you would work on within most for profit companies.   Pay is what you'd expect to find at a for profit but the benefits are much better.  Cool building to work in and a lot of flexible work options that make life easier for working parents.  

There are a lot of internal training options but it seems like their  focus has really been on improving managers.
cons:
I don't know why but it seems like managers are more likely to share positive feedback than constructive feedback.  Leaves you with a feeling that you never really know what kind of performance rating to expect.  

There are a lot of meetings and this doesn't allow for much time to think or even do work!

Process for decisions feels like it slows down progress.  Feels like everything needs to be presented formally to the top leadership or a group of people that decide which projects get the green light.

job_title: Senior Manager IT Support Services in Northfield, IL
pros: High quality company to work for
cons: Sometimes overly collaborative - everyone wants to be involved in everything

job_title: Linux Systems Administrator in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: the company has a good environment
cons: Not that bad when it comes for busy time

pros: Good pay, benefits, good internal training offered by HR.  Many long term employees and MANY good non-management workers who are team players and hard workers.
cons: The biggest con at the CAP is upper management that is incompetent. A lot of favoritism, too much management and not enough workers.  Too many managers of no one and very top heavy management that does not listen to the needs of the employees.  Tendency to push technology into the production state before fully tested and kinks worked out causing problems and delays on the working class who have to deal with multiple time consuming work- arounds. This just ends up being added stress on the workers.  Many employees, even those who have been at CAP long term are unhappy with management decisions that make no sense.

job_title: Senior Technical Specialist in Northfield, IL
pros: Consistent hours, no weekends/holidays, good benefits, educational opportunities.
cons: Not all salaried positions have the schedule flexibility one might hope for.

review_title: The company itself is good!  It's management that ruins the experience.
pros: Great benefits.  HR does good job showing employees are appreciated, however management quickly erases any appreciation the company shows their employees.  Great pay, work/life balance, ok vacation and holiday time off, yearly bonus if you don't get a bad review, they let some staff work from home. Great 401k matching and additional contribution at end of year.
cons: Your manager can make or break you, and varies depending on what dept you end up in.  Inconsistant perks from dept to dept.  No to little opportunity for advancement either.   Employees sit in same job with no promotions for years or title increase. Lots of new hires are relatives and friends of employees are not qualified for jobs. Management is hired or moved in place because of senority or a friend recommendation and  have no business managing people.  Words such as bipolar, crazy, moody are used to describe mgmt.    Very little system support, creates a lot of manual work.  The company does not accept change well and they like to do things like they've also done them.  Discouraged from thinking outside the box.  Managers can be  demeaning and bullies.  Takes a long time to be vested in benefits listed above.

pros: Regularly benchmarked salaries. Good benefits that change to match common practice. Great cafe. Very smart staff. People smile and acknowledge one another while passing in the hallways. When you walk around, you see people engaging with one another at their work spaces and in huddle rooms. It looks energizing, collaborative, and that two-way communication is taking place.
cons: Weekend travel is required for those attending member meetings ("comp" time can be used to account for weekend travel) so having or creating a flexible personal life is important for success at the CAP.

pros:
As a new team member, I'm already making a significant impact and advancing the specialty of pathology. I touch many segments of the organization and I know the work I'm doing is helping to improve people's health. 

Many of the employees I've met are enthusiastic and passionate about the CAP and the work we do. They're extremely smart and always willing to share their knowledge cross-functionally.
cons: As the CAP adapts to meet external demands and pressures, it may not feel like the family-oriented culture some remember. Even as we grow and navigate these changes, the culture is still warm, collaborative and collegial.

pros: Pays well, flexible hours ... these are the only things I can think of that are positive at the CAP.
cons: The CAP is an organization that is stuck in its ways. There are people in the organization that have been here for years, get paid a ton, but don’t do much at all. The organization is very top heavy (for no good reason) and employees that are in those management/supervisor roles are not managing/supervising much from what I can see. Employee development is nonexistent (everyone just goes through the motions). There’s no real incentive to do well here and those that do, do well are not properly recognized and rewarded.

review_title: The CAP…A Special Place To Work
pros: I loved my time at The CAP! I am a former employee who worked for The CAP for over 10 years. It was an incredibly difficult decision to leave because I loved working for this company and built amazing relationships with people across the organization. The environment is very familial and friendly. People really care about each other and you have the opportunity to work cross-functionally here on different project teams. During my tenure, I worked for three amazing women who taught me so much. I am forever grateful for my experience here in terms of learning and being challenged. I was fortunate enough to work with a solid team and the company is small enough where you can really get to know senior leaders and feel you are making an impact. It’s very common to see the CEO walk around and stop by to chat to get to know the employees and be visible and connected. Another huge pro were the benefits. The insurance coverage and flexibility was top notch, too. This company cares about the well-being of their employees. Another benefit was the Learning & Development programs which not only focused on soft skills, but focused on learning the business and applying knowledge back on the job.
cons: Every company has opportunities. I’d say the biggest opportunity is the lack of upward mobility and positioning employees for the future- higher level or even different jobs to expand on skill-sets. I felt I was outgrowing my role, but there were limitations with where to go next in the organization. It would have been great to have a more clearly defined career path and be “groomed” for a specific next step. People tend stay in roles for a really long time and become very comfortable. It becomes difficult to move around. It would have been more motivating to see there was a role I was working towards or create job rotation opportunities to try new skill-sets.

review_title: Great organization in advocacy for the profession of Anatomic Pathology
pros: Total focus on advocacy and education for physicians and students of Anatomic Pathology.  Strong representation from more than 18,000 members across 30+ countries.  Long track record of 50 years as the non-profit organization for AP.
cons: Vision outside of the immediate AP space is limited if compared to other healthcare organizations worldwide.  CAP is about AP which means that most discussion is only in that space and not more about how that part of the overall medical profession can move to the forefront of leading the transformation of healthcare on more of an enterprise-wide scale.

review_title: Cutting edge at a breakneck speed
pros: Several year ago the company started migrating all legacy applications to a single platform. Cutting edge technology is more a norm now than an exception.  If you are a software developer and looking for an opportunity to pick up new skills and significantly enhance your resume, College will meet and exceed your expectations.  But be prepared to work hard.
cons: There are a lot of initiatives, especially in the IT area.  But often it feels like more people are needed to sustain a breakneck speed the company tries to maintain.  Work-life balance often takes a back seat to achieving aggressive goals.

pros: The CAP provides an excellent environment to work with good work/life balance. My colleagues are engaged, and very knowledgeable in their responsibilities. I have always felt like part of a team, and  my ideas are treated with respect.
cons: There is a tendency to have too many meetings. Also, projects start and stop and no one knows why and if they will be picked up again.

pros: This place has a lot of loyal customers. As a non-for-profit, this company pays as well as large corporations. There are some smart people in this office, some are long-time employees and others have good experience from labs, other companies, and industries.
cons: Management does not stay in touch with staff. There is a feeling that lower employees are kept in the dark about what is going on. Communication from the chiefs is rah-rah and vague.

job_title: Call Center Agent in Northfield, IL
pros: The stable hours, the generous PTO, the good health benefits (after 1 year), the helpfulness of my co-workers, being able to help others.
cons: No career opportunities, didn't feel valued, micromanagement, and poor organization communication. The programs I needed for my job were constantly unavailable, making both staff and customers frustrated.

review_title: Potential to be a great place to work

There is an antiquated culture of delegating decisions to the physician members even in areas where they have little to no experience.

pros: Employees are very experience.  They are very knowledgeable and are a committed team.  they are focused on the customer / member.
cons: The College is undergoing a lot of change right now.  There is a lot of uncertainity among the staff and management.

pros: Co workers can be resources as they have long tenures, know they will not grow any further, know they have hit the ceiling
